intro: Hionanthera mossambicensis, commonly known as the Mozambique starflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It features palmate leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
